title: The Block's Mitch and Mark run out of money putting their build in jeopardy
text:
The Block's Mitch and Mark ran out of money on the show on Monday.

The pair - who have long been front runners on the show - were shocked after they realised they had to pay bills up to a whopping $16,000, which they weren't sure they could afford.

At one point, their rivals sneered at the news, with Tess proclaiming: 'Welcome to the peasant side.'

'I just feel embarrassed that I didn't have a handle on it': The Block's Mitch (L) and Mark (R) ran out of money on the show on Monday putting their build in jeopardy... as rival Tess sneered 'welcome to the peasant side'

The pair had to let their tradesmen go, as they had no money to pay them.

It meant their build was in jeopardy, as they didn't think they had enough to finish the terrace this week and other touch ups around the house.

'We've always been happy to pay the going rate and never asked for a discount... we thought your value was worth that,' Mark told the tradesmen as he let them go.

Taking a swipe: At one point, their rivals sneered at the news, with Tess (L) proclaiming: 'Welcome to the peasant side'

'We can't have you working if I can't pay you,' he added.

'I'm not happy, I'm not proud of myself.'

To camera, he said he was 'embarrassed' about the way he handled their finances, with the budgeting left up to him.

'I felt embarrassed that I didn't have a handle on it, the way I thought I had a handle on it.'

Getting through it: Mitch soon tried to snap Mark out of it and said they had no time to 'wallow in pity'

Mitch soon tried to snap Mark out of it and said they had no time to 'wallow in pity.'

'It's not going to help by being down. Be numb and don't think about it... We need to pick our s**t up and make it happen,' Mitch said.

Their rivals appeared to sneer at Mitch and Mark coming undone, with Tess proclaiming: 'It's about time they had a taste of what poor feels like.'

'Welcome, welcome to the peasant side.'

Jesse and girlfriend Mel said they hope the boys wouldn't find money to fix their tiles near the staircase, which didn't get a rave review from judges.
description: The Block's Mitch and Mark ran out of money on the show on Monday.
authors: Chloe-Lee Longhetti For Daily Mail Australia
